ARABIC: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ أَجْرَمُوا۟ كَانُوا۟ مِنَ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ يَضْحَكُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Those who did evil used to laugh at those who had iman.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: The sinners indeed laughed at believers
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Behold, the wicked were wont to laugh at the believers:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: The sinners had been laughing at the believers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Indeed the guilty used to laugh at the believers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Verily, those who committed crimes used to laugh at those who believed.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Surely they who are guilty used to laugh at those who believe.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Behold, the sinners were laughing at the believers,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Lo! the guilty used to laugh at those who believed,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: The wicked used to laugh at the believers --
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Veriiy those who have sinned were wont at those who had believed to laugh,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Indeed the guilty used to laugh at the faithful,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Those in sin used to laugh at those who believed,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Verily! (During the worldly life) those who committed crimes used to laugh at those who believed.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: The sinners laughed at the believers
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Those who committed crimes used to laugh at those who believed.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Indeed, those who committed crimes used to laugh at those who believed.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [83:29] Verily the guilty, like Abū Jahl and his ilk, used to laugh at the believers, such as ‘Ammār [b. Yāsir] and Bilāl [the Ethiopian] and those like them, in mockery of them;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Lo! the guilty) the idolaters, Abu Jahl and his host (used to laugh at those who believed) used to mock and poke fun at 'AN and his fellow believers,
